comments:
During editing a C++ file I obtained a CReconciler related exception and many
lines in my file where bogusly red marked containing an error. I was forced
to close and reopen the file to make the error markers go away.

Since this is the first time that I see this problem in CTD 4.0M5 it's maybe not yet know (at least I did not found a bug report).

Exception in thread "org.eclipse.cdt.internal.ui.text.CReconciler" java.lang.ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException: 0
        at org.eclipse.cdt.internal.ui.editor.InactiveCodeHighlighting.collectInactiveCodePositions(InactiveCodeHighlighting.java:249)
        at org.eclipse.cdt.internal.ui.editor.InactiveCodeHighlighting.reconciled(InactiveCodeHighlighting.java:186)
        at org.eclipse.cdt.internal.ui.editor.CEditor.reconciled(CEditor.java:3026)
        at org.eclipse.cdt.internal.ui.text.CReconcilingStrategy.reconcile(CReconcilingStrategy.java:147)
        at org.eclipse.cdt.internal.ui.text.CReconcilingStrategy.reconcile(CReconcilingStrategy.java:70)
        at org.eclipse.jface.text.reconciler.MonoReconciler.process(MonoReconciler.java:75)
        at org.eclipse.jface.text.reconciler.AbstractReconciler$BackgroundThread.run(AbstractReconciler.java:204)

PS: Not sure whether it is useful but the error happened in a member function which was followed by two non member functions embedded in namespace { ... }.

I could not reproduce, but fixed it anyway.
Available in builds > 20070427.
